meanings.definition: A long, high-pitched call used to attract attention or express a greeting.
meanings.sent1: I heard a distant cooey in the forest, signaling someone nearby.
meanings.sent2: She gave a loud cooey to get her friend's attention across the field.
meanings.sent3: The cooey of the bird made the forest feel alive with sound.
meanings.sent4: His cooey echoed through the valley, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The cooey of the lost child pierced through the silence, guiding the search party.

meanings.definition: To utter the sound 'cooey' as a call or greeting.
meanings.sent1: He cooeyed loudly to let his friends know he had arrived.
meanings.sent2: The hiker cooeyed to signal his location to the rescue team.
meanings.sent3: She playfully cooeyed from the balcony to surprise her cat below.
meanings.sent4: The old man cooeyed every morning to greet his neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The coach cooeyed instructions to the players on the field, guiding their movements.
